results.title: Tess the old girl
results.brief_description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. This much loved dog has become part of the family and enjoys nothing better than chasing trucks , barking at possums, and pulling clothes off the line. Spoilt she may be but everyone loves the old girl.
results.description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. results.title: My new home
results.creator_credit: Jaya Sharma and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A story of a young woman’s life journey - from a young bride in India to become the head of Hindi radio at SBS in Melbourne. Created in the ACMI ‘Diversity@Work’ Digital Storytelling program in association with Diversity @ Work, AMES, Australia POst and SBS.

results.title: The Story of an immigrant filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Agnes Karlik and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.
results.description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.

results.title: The Sacrifice
results.brief_description: A narrative of courage, family and a life saved. Dragush’s father was dying of kidney failure. His father’s sister, Lina, travelled half way across the world to Australia from Albania, leaving her home and family behind, so that she could help save her brother’s life by donating one of her own kidneys. This story is a dedication to Aunty Lina and the importance of family.
results.description: A narrative of courage, family and a life saved. Dragush’s father was dying of kidney failure. His father’s sister, Lina, travelled half way across the world to Australia from Albania, leaving her home and family behind, so that she could help save her brother’s life by donating one of her own kidneys. This story is a dedication to Aunty Lina and the importance of family.

results.title: Waterholes : our turn
results.creator_credit: Kaye Munroe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kaye Munroe remembers the day the devastating Gippsland bushfires came to her doorstep. The ‘travelling fingers’ of the bushfire threatened not only her home but the beauty of the area she loved. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: The Host Monogama
results.brief_description:
Determination will get you anywhere but tread carefully.

This short film was created by students of the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) at RMIT University in Melbourne. Featuring hand-illustrated characters and settings, animated using a paper cutout technique.

results.title: Whitefellanormal
results.creator_credit: Vernon Ah Kee, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.material_description: single channel digital video, colour, sound, 30 min duration
results.brief_description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.
